meanings.definition: To inhale suddenly with the mouth open, usually as a reaction to surprise or shock.
meanings.sent1: She gasps when she sees the magician make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent2: He always gasps when he watches scary movies.
meanings.sent3: The puppy gasps in amazement as the ball bounces around the room.
meanings.sent4: The forest gasps with anticipation as the storm clouds gather.
meanings.sent5: The child gasps with wonder at the sight of the fireworks.

meanings.definition: A sudden intake of breath, usually as a reaction to surprise or shock.
meanings.sent1: The loud gasps from the audience filled the theater.
meanings.sent2: Her gasps of delight could be heard across the room.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's tiny gasps of excitement were adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The silence was broken by the gasps of the students as the surprise was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The gasps of the crowd echoed through the stadium as the winning goal was scored.
